ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I do not recommend this course to anyone.

The course on theory and aesthetics before 1600 is a survey of the most important information and documents in music theory through the Renaissance. I would recommend the course to any student of music theory, because this body of knowledge can be difficult to learn without an instructor, and it constitutes essential background for many conventions of Western art music that we now take for granted.
I would not recommend this course to anyone under any circumstances.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course did not contribute to my knowledge level or my professional preparedness.

This course greatly improved my comprehension of many important concepts in the history of theory, such as the Greek system of tetrachords, Guidonian hexachordal solmization, and the practice of musica ficta. Even if I do not draw upon this knowledge in future research, I think every scholar of Western art music should have a solid understanding of it.
This course forced me to memorize a lot of useless information.
